column2: Tindak Malaysia (2023). Refer to Detailed Source/Explanation section of this metadata file for detailed source background for 1955 Election Results Refer to MALAYA_1955_DUN_CANDIDATE_AGE_SOURCE for candidate age sources

There may be discrepancies for the age of candidates as there is no official data released for the attribute.There are missing data points for age attribute for candidates and total electors.Unless there is information about candidates losing deposit, most of the state election results do not have records of candidates losing deposit (with some exceptions). For Perak, candidates lost deposit if they win less than one-sixth of the votes cast. Johor Candidates lose deposit if they win less than 1/10 of total votes cast in their constituency.  No clarity whether PMIP and PMIA are referring to same party. State Election Results files are separated as first elections to state legislative councils were done separately from 1954 to 1955. Though some states do not have values of Other Party (2) or multiple Independents, the column headings were standardized so that a user can combine data files into single sheet if they want to. TindakMalaysia Network Services PLT is not responsible for any errors or ommissions arising from the original data or its derivatives

column1: Federation of Malay Government Gazette - Government of Perlis 6th October 1955
Perlis DUN Candidates did not contest under party symbols, but using symbols that is commonly used for Independents in current era
Perlis state legislative council elections were held on 24/9/1955
Constituency Names and Candidate Names were corrected as per Federation of Malaya Government Gazette - Government of Kedah 25th August 1955
Nominations were done around 15th August 1955. No Elections were carried out as Alliance had a walkover
Constituency Names per Federation of Malaya Government Gazette - Government of Kelantan 1st September 1955

Constituency Results and Candidate Names as per Federation of Malaya Government Gazette - Goverment of Kelantan 13th October 1955. Candidate Names for 13th October 1955 is far more detailed than Government Gazette of 1st September 1955
Sex category for Lee Keng Chuan was an educated guess
Kelantan Council of State Elections were held on 19th September 1955
Constituency Names and Candidates names per Federation of Malaya Government Gazette - Government of Trengganu - 18th November 1954
Uncontested Winner Names as per Federation of Malaya Governmetn Gazette - Government of Trengganu - 14th October 1954
Information on Negara and Independent Candidates are patchy and conflicting. There is conflicting information whether Mohd. Ali bin Haji Awang Omar belongs to Negara or being Independent

No substantial information was present to verify Independent status of Haji Ali Omar (Dato' Bentara Muda), Che' Abdullah bin Ibrahim (of which another Straits Times claim he has entered Negara), Che' Abullah bin Awang and Syed Agil bin Mahusain
Ulu Trengganu witnessed a clash of two UMNO candidates
Total Alliance votes, Total Negara votes and Total Independent votes does not tally with Straits Times data

Government Gazette information on total electors are debateable. Following are the Constituencies where voting potential numbers used - Setiu, Kuala Trengganu Utara, Kuala Trengganu Barat, Ulu Trengganu and Dungun
Information on Turnout should be used with maximum discretion
Trengganu Election candidates do not use party symbols but use symbols that are usually associated with independents today
Names corrected using Federation of Malaya Government Gazette - Government of the Settlement of Penang 10th February 1955
Total Electors is from Federation of Malaya Government Gazette - Government of the Settlement of Penang 10th March 1955
Penang Election candidates do not use party symbols but use symbols that are usually associated with independents today
Federation of Malaya Government Gazette - Perak 27th January 1955
Federation of Malaya Government Gazette - Perak 27th October 1955
Federation of Malaya Government Gazette - Perak 17th November 1955
Federation of Malaya Government Gazetter - Negri Sembilan 22nd September 1955
Federation of Malaya Government Gazette - Negri Sembilan 27th October 1955
Negri Sembilan Elections were held on 12/10/1955
Negri Sembilan Election candidates do not use party symbols but use symbols that are usually associated with independents today
Federation of Malaya Government Gazette - Settlement of Malacca 25th August 1955
Malacca elections were not done as there was complete walkover by Alliance on 4th August 1955
Federation of Malaya Government Gazette - Johore 26th August 1954
Federation of Malaya Government Gazette - Johore 23rd September 1954
Federation of Malaya Government Gazette - Johore 7th October 1954
Federation of Malaya Government Gazette - Johore 21st October 1954
Johor Candidates lose deposit if they win less than 1/10 of total votes cast in their constituency
All Candidates sexes were derived by designations found in the above government gazettes from 23rd September 1954
Candidate affliation of Chelvasingam-Macintyre is debateable as some source affix MIC affliation and some use UMNO affliation
Johore Election candidates do not use party symbols but use symbols that are usually associated with independents today
Supplement to Federation of Malaya Government Gazette - Government of Pahang 15/9/1955
Supplement to Federation of Malaya Government Gazette - Government of Pahang 22/9/1955 (For Uncontested winners)

Supplement to Federation of Malaya Government Gazette - Government of Pahang 13/10/1955 (For Election Results, candidate names of the gazette conflicts with 15/9/1955 Gazette. Names follow 15/9/1955 Gazette)
Alternative name for Lipis East is Kuala Lipis East
Straits Times 21st February 1955, 15th August 1955, 11th October 1955, 21st September 1955, Warisan Kelantan (1997), Federation of Malaya Government Gazette 1954.
